chapter.title: &rmt; tools and configuration files

meta.name: description
meta.content: Learn how to manage RMT repositories and clients efficiently using the rmt-cli command-line interface, which includes sub-commands for synchronizing databases.

chapter.para: This chapter describes the most important scripts, configuration files and certificates shipped with &rmt;.

The rmt-cli command and its sub-commands are used to manage the mirroring of repositories, registration of clients, and reporting. &systemd; is used for starting, stopping, restarting the &rmt; service and for checking its status.
The basic configuration for &rmt; is stored in the /etc/rmt.conf.
